perturbation.original_text: Sabco shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Prolong, its officers, directors, employees and representatives from and against any and all losses, claims, suits, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including attorney fees and count costs incurred by any of them arising out of: (i) Any breach of any warrant made by Sabco herein; (ii) Any acts done or words spoken (iii) Any claims by any persons arising from acts or omissions of any nature by Sabco, its employees or agents, including but not limited to, claims arising during the court of competition or practice in the performance of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Sabco shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Prolong, its officers, directors, employees and representatives only for direct damages, excluding any consequential or punitive damages, arising directly from Sabco's gross negligence. This indemnification shall not extend to claims arising from the inherent risks of motorsport activities.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text significantly limits the scope of Sabco's indemnification obligations. By excluding consequential and punitive damages and limiting it to gross negligence, Prolong's protection is reduced. Furthermore, excluding inherent motorsport risks weakens the protection, creating uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and unambiguous indemnification clauses.

perturbation.original_text: Prolong shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Sabco, its officers, directors, employees and representatives, from and against any and all losses, claims, suits, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including attorney fees and court costs incurred by any of them, arising out of: (i) The use of any logo, design or materials furnished to Sabco by Prolong hereunder; (ii) Any breach of any warranty made by Prolong herein; (iii) Any acts done or words spoken by Prolong, its officers, directors, agents, employees and representatives; (iv) Any claims by any persons arising from acts of omissions of any nature by Prolong, its officers, directors, agents, employees or representatives, including, but not limited to, claims arising under any product liability theory with respect to Prolong's products.
perturbation.changed_text: Prolong shall indemnify Sabco for claims arising directly from use of Prolong's logos or designs, provided Sabco uses said logos and designs exactly as provided and without modification. Prolong is not responsible for indemnifying Sabco for any other reason, including claims against Prolong's products due to product liability.
perturbation.explanation: The revised clause adds a condition that indemnification for logo/design use only applies if Sabco uses them exactly as provided, potentially leading to dispute over minor alterations. Additionally, the explicit exclusion of product liability claims creates uncertainty and drastically reduces Prolong's exposure, which is normally part of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles, product liability laws.

perturbation.original_text: Governing Law, Jurisdiction and Venue. This Agreement shall be ------------------------------------- governed by and construed in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of North Carolina. The parties hereto hereby submit to jurisdiction and venue in any state or federal court located in North Carolina as well as any other jurisdiction having venue and competent jurisdiction of any law suit arising out of or relating to this Agreement; provided, however, if any proceedings are instituted in a jurisdiction other than North Carolina, any party may remove such proceeding to any State or Federal Court in North Carolina.
perturbation.changed_text: Governing Law, Jurisdiction and Venue. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with principles of equity and fairness, as determined by the parties at the time of dispute. While both parties acknowledge the laws of North Carolina, the final determination of applicable law rests with mutual agreement in the case of any dispute.
perturbation.explanation: The revision replaces North Carolina law with 'principles of equity and fairness, as determined by the parties', making the governing law ambiguous and unenforceable. The acknowledgement of North Carolina law is immediately contradicted by allowing a later 'mutual agreement', leading to confusion.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law requiring a clear and defined choice of law.
perturbation.location: Section 17. Governing Law, Jurisdiction and Venue.
